children: A 30-year-old woman is evaluated for an incidentally found abnormality on a contrast-enhanced chest
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

This image from contrast-enhanced CT of the chest reveals a well-circumscribed nodule within the left upper lobe. Nodules are less than or equal to 30 mm in size, whereas masses are greater than 30 mm. No other discrete nodular infiltrates are noted on this image, although differentiating an enhancing nodule from a vessel may be difficult without the use of multiple contiguous images. Vessels, however, become progressively smaller in diameter with distance from the hilum, whereas the contrast-enhancing finding shown here is clearly larger than vessels much closer to the hilum.

objective.__html: Recognize a solitary pulmonary nodule on a chest CT scan.
